rev.diff:
Line 74: Line 74:
The '''Galaxy Nexus''' <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/samsung-and-google-introduce-galaxy-nexus-2011-10-18|title=Samsung and Google introduce GALAXY Nexus|publisher=[[MarketWatch]]|date=October 19, 2011}}</ref> is a forthcoming [[touchscreen]] [[Slate phone|slate]] [[Android (OS)|Android]] [[smartphone]] manufactured by [[Samsung]] for [[Google]]. The phone and operating system were developed collaboratively by engineers from both companies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9220984/Samsung_Google_unveil_latest_Android_OS_phone|title=Samsung, Google unveil latest Android OS, phone|publisher=''[[Computerworld]]''|date=October 19, 2011|accessdate=October 19, 2011}}</ref> It is the third generation successor to the [[Nexus One]] and [[Nexus S]] Googleâs previous flagship phones. It has an entirely new design and includes a host of hardware and software upgrades including a curved HD display, an improved camera system, and Googleâs new version of its Android operating system (Android 4.0, codenamed "Ice Cream Sandwich"). <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsungs-galaxy-nexus-gets-official-android-4-0-4-65-inch-hd|title=Samsung's Galaxy Nexus gets official: Android 4.0, 4.65-inch HD Super AMOLED display (video)|publisher=[[Engadget]]|date=October 18, 2011}}</ref> The name is the result of [[co-branding]] between Samsung's ''Galaxy'' and Google's ''Nexus'' brands of Android smartphones.
The '''Galaxy Nexus''' <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/samsung-and-google-introduce-galaxy-nexus-2011-10-18|title=Samsung and Google introduce GALAXY Nexus|publisher=[[MarketWatch]]|date=October 19, 2011}}</ref> is a forthcoming [[touchscreen]] [[Slate phone|slate]] [[Android (OS)|Android]] [[smartphone]] manufactured by [[Samsung]] for [[Google]]. The phone and operating system were developed collaboratively by engineers from both companies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9220984/Samsung_Google_unveil_latest_Android_OS_phone|title=Samsung, Google unveil latest Android OS, phone|publisher=''[[Computerworld]]''|date=October 19, 2011|accessdate=October 19, 2011}}</ref> It is the third generation successor to the [[Nexus One]] and [[Nexus S]] Googleâs previous flagship phones. It has an entirely new design and includes a host of hardware and software upgrades including a curved HD display, an improved camera system, and Googleâs new version of its Android operating system (Android 4.0, codenamed "Ice Cream Sandwich"). <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsungs-galaxy-nexus-gets-official-android-4-0-4-65-inch-hd|title=Samsung's Galaxy Nexus gets official: Android 4.0, 4.65-inch HD Super AMOLED display (video)|publisher=[[Engadget]]|date=October 18, 2011}}</ref> The name is the result of [[co-branding]] between Samsung's ''Galaxy'' and Google's ''Nexus'' brands of Android smartphones.
â
The Galaxy Nexus was unveiled at Google and Samsungâs ''Ice Cream Sandwich'' event on October 19th, 2011 in [[Hong Kong, China]] (October 18th in the Western Hemisphere). Google and Samsung were initially going to release it at their Unpacked event at [[CTIA]] but issued a statement postponing the event. A Samsung spokesperson issued a follow up statement to [[CNET]] confirming speculation that the postponement was due to the passing of [[Steve Jobs]]. It is scheduled to be released in November, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gizmodo.com/5851133/samsung-galaxy-nexus-the-greatest-androids-got-a-720p-super-amoled-display|title=Gizmodo report}}</ref>
+
The Galaxy Nexus was unveiled at Google and Samsungâs ''Ice Cream Sandwich'' event on October 19th, 2011 in [[Hong Kong, China]] (October 18th in the Western Hemisphere). It is scheduled to be released in November, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gizmodo.com/5851133/samsung-galaxy-nexus-the-greatest-androids-got-a-720p-super-amoled-display|title=Gizmodo report}}</ref>
==Announcement==
==Announcement==
â
Prior to the unveiling there were repeated leaks of various details on the upcoming new Google phone. <ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/06/samsung-galaxy-nexus-specs-leak-headed-to-verizon-as-an-exclusi|title=Galaxy Nexus Specs Revealed?}}</ref> Specifications on the phone varied including information about the processor and the camera. After the official unveiling some started to worry about the 5 megapixel camera but most of the fears were put to rest when photo and video samples were shown. <ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZhlL-ys5iOA&feature=feedf|title=Video Sample}}</ref> The phone was announced on October 19, 2011 in [[Hong Kong]] (October 18 in the [[Western Hemisphere]]),<ref name="brighthand18084">[http://www.brighthand.com/default.asp?newsID=18084&news=Google+OS+Android+Nexus+Prime+release+date Google Nexus Prime Set for October Launch]</ref> revealing the official name as "Galaxy Nexus"<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/galaxy-nexus-ice-cream-sandwich-roundup-specs-details-and-ins/ Galaxy Nexus, Ice Cream Sandwich roundup: specs, details and insight, oh my! - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>, and not "Nexus Prime", another rumored name for the device.<ref>[http://www.wired.co.uk/reviews/mobile-phones/2011-10/samsung-galaxy-nexus-mobile-phone-review Samsung Galaxy Nexus review: Android 4.0, specs, release date (Wired UK)<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
+
Prior to the unveiling there were repeated leaks of various details on the upcoming new Google phone. <ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/06/samsung-galaxy-nexus-specs-leak-headed-to-verizon-as-an-exclusi|title=Galaxy Nexus Specs Revealed?}}</ref> Specifications on the phone varied including information about the processor and the camera.
  +
Google and Samsung were initially going to release it at their Unpacked event at [[CTIA]] but issued a statement postponing the event. A Samsung spokesperson issued a follow up statement to [[CNET]] confirming speculation that the postponement was due to the passing of [[Steve Jobs]].
  +
After the official unveiling some started to worry about the 5 megapixel camera but most of the fears were put to rest when photo and video samples were shown. <ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZhlL-ys5iOA&feature=feedf|title=Video Sample}}</ref> The phone was announced on October 19, 2011 in [[Hong Kong]] (October 18 in the [[Western Hemisphere]]),<ref name="brighthand18084">[http://www.brighthand.com/default.asp?newsID=18084&news=Google+OS+Android+Nexus+Prime+release+date Google Nexus Prime Set for October Launch]</ref> revealing the official name as "Galaxy Nexus"<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/galaxy-nexus-ice-cream-sandwich-roundup-specs-details-and-ins/ Galaxy Nexus, Ice Cream Sandwich roundup: specs, details and insight, oh my! - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>, and not "Nexus Prime", another rumored name for the device.<ref>[http://www.wired.co.uk/reviews/mobile-phones/2011-10/samsung-galaxy-nexus-mobile-phone-review Samsung Galaxy Nexus review: Android 4.0, specs, release date (Wired UK)<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
